author: n3tsurge
description: This capability involves establishing the ability to find processes by their metadata. This includes implementing mechanisms to search and filter processes based on various metadata attributes such as process name, user, command line arguments, and other relevant information. It is essential for incident response, system monitoring, and security assessments, providing visibility into process activities and enabling the identification of potentially malicious or unauthorized processes.

requirements.description: Staff must be trained and qualified to perform this capability effectively.
Documented procedures and playbooks must be available for executing this capability.

title: Establish Ability to Find Processes by Metadata

references.name: NIST SP 800-137: Information Security Continuous Monitoring (ISCM)
MITRE ATT&CK: Discovery Tactics and Detection Strategies
CISA Zero Trust Architecture - Monitoring and Analytics
